IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The agency was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• There was no technical assistance requested or required.
V. CONSULTATION
The agency was offered consultation in the following areas:
• Consultant provided consultation as it pertains to Rule 400.10113 employee
records (d) three references which are obtained before employment from persons
unrelated to the employee. Facility was provided the feedback to make sure all
references that are completed either by phone or email are documented all within
the staff's human resources file and easy to locate. There were three new
employees noted where they were missing one reference because the phone
reference notes were not located within their human resource file and had to be
found by the human resource team. The facility was found in compliance with the
rule as there was a reference found for each, but it should be all stored in one
location.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
Maltreatment in Care
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted 1 acceptable corrective action plans (CAP) during this
licensing period, and compliance with each individual CAP is as follows: During
this period of review there were three special investigations that occurred with only
one resulting in a corrective action plan. Special Investigation 2025SIC0000376
with CAP approval date April 10, 2025, was a result of a violation for staff not
following the approved restraint model. The agency has updated their use of force
policy and retrained all staff in the approved restraint model. The agency has been
in compliance with all action steps within the CAP. DCWL continues to monitor
CAP compliance for six months on a quarterly basis.

N/A

N/A
3

Chief Administrator Assessment
Not Applicable.
Staff and Youth Interviews
Staff interviews were conducted during the inspection. The staff reported they felt
well supported by their teammates, direct supervisor, and administration team.
They reported they feel the training lately has been very beneficial, especially as it
comes to the youth's mental health and behavior management. Staff reported
feeling that if they have a concern about a situation or job satisfaction that
leadership takes this seriously.
Youth interviews were conducted during the onsite visit. Youth reported feeling safe
and having a positive relationship with staff. They reported they feel they can go to
staff with any concerns and feel that staff have the capacities to handle a youth's
behaviors. The youth reported the only thing they would change is the food
because they want better food choices. One youth provided the suggestion of doing
music therapy and having different instruments brought in for the youth to use. This
idea was shared with administration.
Description of Agency Walk Through
An onsite inspection and walkthrough of the facility occurred on May 21, 2025.
There were no issues or safety concerns noted.
4

VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules. It is recommended that the agency continue on their regular license.
